content: i see the mention background changed recently — overall i like this (the gradient was imo pretty ugly), but i find it a lot harder to notice mentions in messages now. could we make the background just a hair darker to make them stand out more?
That’s another symptom of the clean-css regression that I fixed in #17416. @Tim Abbott that should probably be deployed here when you get a chance.

oh, i see :sweat_smile: well, is it worth considering switching to using a flat grey background once that's merged in? i do think that would look a bit nicer, although if the change wasn't on purpose than there's a much stronger argument for keeping the status quo.

also, excellent branch name btw :)

@Wesley Aptekar-Cassels I'd be curious to see what you have in mind as a visual prototype with screenshot. We're always open to design tweaks but it'll be a lot easier to get feedback from the community with before/after screenshots.

i'm a fan of how they look on mobile, just taking that CSS and putting it in the webapp would be good, i think:

zulip-mobile-mention-tag.png

I think that's actually what they used to look like in the webapp; I think we got complaints that the grey background for mentions looked ugly. Might be worth doing a poll at some point, but I'd love some commentary from anyone reading this.

Time widgets, mentions and silent mentions all have similar background color in the webapp, which IMO is a bit odd.
In the mobile app, inline codeblocks also have a similar background color as those above.

hmm, interesting. if that's the case, i think keeping it as is is fine — i mostly brought this up because i thought it was changing anyways.

i personally think that the fact that time widgets/mentions/silent mentions looks the same is good, since they seem to me like the same category of thing (interactive/dynamic parts of a message)
